item.title: Toronto's Shelters During the COVID-19 Pandemic
item.description: Abstract This study seeks to examine the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on the occupancy of Torontoâ€™s homeless shelters. From the public Shelter Occupancy data set it is observed that during the spread of the virus, demand for spaces in shelters decreased significantly. Although there is not enough data available to fully comprehend the causal factors of this perhaps surprising result. Introduction The Toronto open data portal contains many up to date public data sets concerning the cities on goings, one of which is the homeless shelter occupancy statistics.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
